meanings.sent1: The pizza was divided into sixths for everyone to have an equal share.
meanings.sent2: She cut the cake into sixths to make sure each guest got a fair portion.
meanings.sent3: The teacher divided the crayons into sixths, causing a colorful chaos in the classroom.
meanings.sent4: In the game, each player represented one of the sixths of the kingdom, vying for control.
meanings.sent5: The sixths of the pie were so perfectly even, it was a work of art.

meanings.definition: The ordinal number corresponding to six in a series.
meanings.sent1: She was the sixth in line to receive her award at the ceremony.
meanings.sent2: The sixth book in the series was the most exciting one yet.
meanings.sent3: The sixth student to arrive at the party won a special prize.
meanings.sent4: He lived on the sixth floor of the building, with a great view of the city.
meanings.sent5: The sixth day of the week always felt like a fresh start.
